Comment: >In an interview with Time published Friday, the president said he had not asked El Salvador to return Abrego Garcia—yet another reminder of the president’s complete disregard for the rule of law.  So he's flat-out admitting that he made zero effort to try to get Abrego Garcia back.  This goes against his whole argument that since Abrego Garcia is in El Salvador, there's nothing the US can do. It's like saying "We've tried nothing and we're all out of ideas."  But the trump administration has changed their whole story, of course, because that's what they do. At first, Abrego Garcia's deportation was an error and there was nothing that can be done since he's in another country. Then the story changed to "Abrego Garcia is a violent gang member, so we purposely sent him to prison in El Salvador." And trump supporters don't care about the changing narrative. They'll believe all the narratives they are fed. If a new narrative about Abrego Garcia comes out tomorrow that contradicts the first two, they'll believe that too.
